ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: In this class we learned about (mostly human) reproductive anatomy and physiology while also learning about and applying lab techniques such as western blotting, PCR, H&E staining, and immunohistochemistry.
I learned some basic scientific techniques (such as western blot and immunohistochemistry). I also learned reproductive biology topics and practiced reading+discussing scientific papers.

I learned about the biology of reproduction from a more practical perspective than lecture (in that we were learning the laboratory aspects of the material rather than just knowledge). I also learned a range of important biology lab techniques, from immunohistochemistry to Western blotting to RT-PCR. I really enjoyed carrying out many of the techniques that I had learned throughout my biology courses at Yale.
I learned many different biological laboratory techniques that I had always heard about but had never tried which was very exciting! From Western Blots to PCR, every week was new and exciting.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Really amazing class that fostered a positive, enriching learning experience. I loved how interactive this course was being in-person most of the time and have fewer than 10 students. I really got to know my classmates, professor, and TA and enjoyed being able to discuss and learn from each other. I enjoyed that this course can be taken without any prior knowledge/experience and does not need to be taken in conjunction with the associated lecture course. The assignments were straightforward and low-stress.

The strength was the content, the in-person component, and the professor. Our class had so much camaraderie and I really enjoyed coming into class. In addition, I learned so much more from one session here than in 3 lectures in the standard class. Professor Whirledge was clear and kind. She expected the best out of us. This was honestly one of the best classes I have ever taken at Yale.

The weakness was that not all of the classes were in person!

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I was glad that there were many COVID precautions in place for the in-person labs.  At no point did I feel worried about the safety of being in lab.

I felt very comfortable going into lab in-person because we followed all safety precautions (wearing masks, lab coats, gloves, etc.). I felt safe and enjoyed being able to experience this lab in-person. It was very interactive and engaging.
I am so happy that I got to have one final class in person! It meant so much that they were able to put that component together. I felt very safe with the precautions.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Absolutely!!  It is a great class where the teaching is focused on your learning not your ability to get a large amount of work done.  Professor Whirledge is great at teaching and also very engaged with the class so you feel super comfortable answering questions, too.
Yes! This was an amazing class to take Senior Spring. Dr. Whirledge is such a wonderful lecturer and made every student feel supported.

Yes! Very great lab course that I am so grateful to have taken before I graduated. One of my most favorite MCDB labs! Very interactive and engaging. Supportive professors and TAs. Assignments were straightforward and not difficult. The homework assignments were low-stress and were not meant to confuse students and only meant to help us learn and succeed. I learned a lot about scientific techniques that I ended up using in my own research lab. Professor Whirledge was very receptive to student questions and showed how much she cared about supporting our success. We ended the course with interactive student presentations on a reproductive disease and it was engaging and fun.

I would definitely recommend this course to another student. In addition to really enjoying the material and activities that we did in class, Professor Whirledge was excellent. Her lectures at the beginning of lab were very straightforward (and helped reinforce material from lecture). She clearly cared about our learning, as well as our interests and what we wanted to do post-Yale. Also, the class is geared towards giving assignment that help your understanding of the material rather than trying to force you to remember nitty-gritty details (this was in contrast to other labs courses that I've taken at Yale). If you can get in, take it!
100%. One of the best classes offered at Yale with one of the best professors. You learn so much about exciting material. Truly excellent course.

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: Some classes were done on Zoom.
In-person lab for most weeks, but we also had some virtual seminars
Some classes were done on Zoom, but most in-person.
